page.title: 10WILDLIFE HARDWICK AREA
page.content: The area is rich in wildlife,farmland & woodland birds abound,there are more owls now,& marsh harrier seen.Wood- peckers seen & heard also plenty of summer & autumn migrants.People are interested in protecting birds,feeding them in winter & providing nest boxes & areas of bushes & rough grass.RSPB members help in the annual sponsored birdwatch.Animal life includes hares rabbits,grey squirrels,hedgehogs,bats stoats,weasels & shrews.A grass snake was seen but few frogs or toads.It's been a good year for dragonflies, butterflies & bees-few wasps.There are still plenty of wild flowers-cowslips & primroses in Springtime. Large numbers of other species survive in field borders & waste land,but sadly many roadside verge plants have disappeared particularly Wild Orchids as ditches & hedgerows are sprayed.
